key_points: There is no evidence linking an Evergreen ship stuck in the Suez Canal to a human trafficking operation purportedly run by Hillary Clinton.
The claim is promoted by followers of the unfounded QAnon conspiracy theory.
Egyptian authorities are working to remove the Evergreen-operated ship, which got stuck on March 23, disrupting a critical global shipping route.
Conspiracy theorists are using the Evergreen Group's connection and Clinton's Secret Service codename as supposed evidence of her involvement.
Facebook flagged a post about the incident as false, as part of its effort to combat misinformation.
Similar unfounded claims have previously appeared after other major incidents, like the Beirut port explosion.
Evergreen Line operates one of the world's largest container fleets and is unrelated to Hillary Clinton.
The ship, Ever Given, became lodged in the canal due to a dust storm, causing significant delays for other ships.
The conspiracy theory suggests Clinton is involved in global child sex trafficking using the codename and shipping company as a cover.
Despite speculation on the ship's cargo, there's no evidence to suggest it was involved in human trafficking.
